channel.title: Using an item on an object
channel.description:
Okay, so i'm making a mini game and I need a couple questions answered. ------- 1. How do I make it so that if I use a key on a chest that it will teleport me somewhere? ------- 2. How do I make it so that if you kill an NPC it teleports you somewhere? ---------------- Please help!
I am using SilabGarza V7 [317] source

item.title: Using an item on an object
item.dc:creator: @Javafire Javafire
item.description:
@Javafire wrote:

[quote=“jmood128, post:9, topic:336251”][quote author=Javafire link=topic=432629.msg3175910#msg3175910 date=1270845089]
well considering 508 is more stable than 317 then that’s the way to go. but i know what to do but i forget the names (haven’t been on rsps since 508 came out :P).
[/quote]
i would, they have a better code system and the cache holds up more to better graphics…
I wouldn’t say 508s are more stable then 317s.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Using an item on an object
item.dc:creator: @wonderspring wonderspring
item.description:
@wonderspring wrote:

if(UsedOnObjectID == OBJECT ID && ItemID == ITEM ID){
toX = coordX;
toY = coordY;
}
This goes to client.java
2.
if(npcs[i].npcType == NPCID){
temp.toX = coordX;
temp.toY = coordY;
}
this goes to npchandler.java

Read full topic

item.title: Using an item on an object
item.dc:creator: @Javafire Javafire
item.description:
@Javafire wrote:

[quote=“DemonsworldOwner, post:2, topic:336251”]Alright please no flaming.
I’d get you all the info you would need.
But I’m about to leave so i will later.
I can tell you what its edidted in.
For the chest part you find the case of the chest and key and do something with using it on and tele coords and such.(Client.java)
Npc teleports is self expltory witch is easy to figure out.
this is in npchandler.java i think it might be in client.java to not sure.
But you could figure that part out.[/quote]
if you don’t know what flaming is plz go away.
@ Dragon. there are about 3,000 tutorials on this. im sure you could use this forum, rune- server, or silabsoft to find it…

ever hear of Tutorial City?

Read full topic
